p: Normal control samples clotted in 44 s but samples of N. haje venom which served as venom control clotted in 720 s. However, various extract partitions of M. oleifera exhibited anticoagulant activities, as samples treated with high dose (600 mg/kg) and low dose (300 mg/kg) of ethyl acetate and ethanol partition of M. oleifera extract inhibited the anticoagulant activity of the venom which was dose dependent. Samples treated with 600 mg/kg of ethyl acetate partition recorded the strongest inhibitory effects at 74 s. Anti-venom samples clotted at 60 s ( Fig. 4).
